ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Experimental condition name
File for trial level forced-response data
File for trial level free reaction time data
Forced-response or Free reaction time task
Notes: 1= Stroop; 2= Simon; 3= Flanker; 4= Color Singleton; 5= Cross-Task; 6= Other

ElementDescription: Description of force-response or free reaction time task
Did you notice any sort of pattern throughout this experiment?
What do you think the pattern was?
Did you find one color of the distractor items particularly more distracting than the other?
Which color did you find more distracting?
Did you notice any sort of pattern in the presentation of color distractor items?
Did you notice that a unique color distractor item always appeared at the same location?
Did noticing this pattern help facilitate how accurately you were able to respond to the unique-shape target on the distractor-present trials?
Notes: 0= Not really, the different color shape still captured my attention; 1= Yes, I felt better able to ignore the distractor when I knew where it was likely to appear; 2 = Other

ElementDescription: Did noticing this pattern help facilitate how accurately you were able to respond to the unique-shape target on the distractor-present trials? Other, specify
Did you notice that a unique color distractor item appeared every 2 trials?
The color of the distractor stimulus ________________.
Notes: 1= Was always the same color; 2= Varied between several different colors; 3 = Do not recall

ElementDescription: Which color was the distractor item?
